alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:30PM EDT until May 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Local law enforcement reports standing water on US 41 in Ishpeming due to high rainfall rates. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Marquette. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marquette, Ishpeming, Negaunee, West Ishpeming and Trowbridge Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
